item.title: Travel Smarter: The Backpack That Doubles as a Mobile Office
item.description:
Travel Smarter: The Backpack That Doubles as a Mobile Office

Our pals at This is Ground recently launched a "smart" backpack that will make you feel like the coolest, most in-the-know traveler out there. Crossing town (or the globe) with a laptop, iPad, headphones, and WiFi port can weigh you down - but it's a reality for many, especially those who work from the road.

item.title: A Clever Headrest That Could Make Flying Actually Bearable
item.description:
A Clever Headrest That Could Make Flying Actually Bearable

There are many reasons to hate flying economy. The tiny seats, the inedible food, the fees airlines charge for things you'd get for free in a medieval dungeon. Manon Kühne can't fix any of that, but she's has found one small way to make sitting in 17C just a bit less hellish.

item.title: Food & Beer (Pre-order) | Food & Cookery | Phaidon Store
item.description:
Food & Beer (Pre-order) | Food & Cookery | Phaidon Store

The debut book by Danish gypsy brewer Jeppe Jarnit-Bjergsø of the bar Tørst, and Canadian chef Daniel Burns of the Michelin-starred restaurant Luksus-both in a shared space in Greenpoint, Brooklyn where they elevate beer to the level of wine in fine dining.

item.title: Bits And Pieces - An organic wave of Hoberman Spheres
item.description:
Bits And Pieces - An organic wave of Hoberman Spheres

Currently on show at Berlin's NOME Gallery is the latest work by Nils Völker titled Bits And Pieces. The installation consists out of 108 mass-produced toy spheres hanging in the middle of the exhibition space, individually addressable and controlled, to create organic waves that appear to move throughout the space.

item.title: 7 Amazing Photos To Celebrate National Parks Week - Moment
item.description:
7 Amazing Photos To Celebrate National Parks Week - Moment

It's National Parks Week! This year is a big one to celebrate as the National Park Service celebrates its 100th birthday! That's 100 years of road trips out west, swimming in lakes, climbing mountains, sharing the roadways with roaming wildlife and camping with friends and family.

item.title: Airbnb's Coolest Tiny Houses in America
item.description:
Airbnb's Coolest Tiny Houses in America

Tiny homes are all the rage, so it makes perfect sense that tiny homes people list on Airbnb are also quite popular. And that's…

item.title: A Collection of Exciting New Booze Books
item.description:
A Collection of Exciting New Booze Books

It seems like just about everyone has a cookbook, cocktail manual or spirits' history guide out on the market. A lot of superb ones cross our path with regularity-from new to old -but some really set themselves apart. Most recently we've been digging through four new offerings and each is very different from the next.

item.title: What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3
item.description:
What it's like to ride in the Tesla Model 3

HAWTHORNE, California - I've had a terrible flu all week. My body aches, my head is pounding, and my throat feels like it might fall out of my neck. Right now, though, I'm riding in the Tesla Model 3, one of the most hotly anticipated cars in the world...

item.title: Finlandia Caviar Shop and Restaurant, Helsinki, Finland
item.description:
Finlandia Caviar Shop and Restaurant, Helsinki, Finland

In designing a space that would be devoted primarily to the consumption of caviar, Helsinki-based designer Joanna Laajisto was careful to avoid clichés of outré parties, fur coats and blinding bling.
